p.strong:
HELLO AND WELCOME TO OUR SURVEY!
YOUR OPINIONS ARE VERY IMPORTANT TO US AND THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR PARTICIPATION.
PLEASE ANSWER EACH QUESTION CAREFULLY AND COMPLETELY. REMEMBER THERE ARE NO RIGHT OR WRONG ANSWERS.
USE THE SCROLL BAR ON THE RIGHT AND BOTTOM OF YOUR SCREEN TO MOVE UP AND DOWN THROUGH QUESTIONS AND IMAGES.
LET’S BEGIN…

radio.label: Agreement1
radio.title:
Respondent Confidentiality Disclosure Agreement (RCDA)
Congratulations!
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this consumer study on behalf of Behaviorally. Before you can participate in this research, we would like you to understand that it will involve Confidential Information and you must agree to these terms and conditions. If you do not agree, you will not be eligible to participate in this study. By signing this agreement, you agree as follows:
You will hold in confidence any information about the products or packaging that may be disclosed to you directly or indirectly by participating in this research.
You will not discuss or otherwise reveal any of the information about the products or packaging disclosed to you with anyone other than the person administering the test.
You will use information disclosed to you only for the purpose of participating in this consumer study, and you will not otherwise use the information for your own benefit or the benefit of any third party.
You will be compensated for your time, commitment, and confidential obligation.
Please confirm your acceptance of these terms by checking the agreement below.

row.label: r1
row.b: I hereby acknowledge and agree to the terms.

survey.html: For the next set of questions, please think about when you last bought over-the counter [pipe:Category] from [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO] [pipe: instoreOnline].

radio.label: Q_SHOP
radio.title: Thinking about the most recent time you bought cough, cold, & flu products at [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO], when did you decide to buy it?

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP1B
checkbox.title: What made you decide to purchase [pipe:Category]?
checkbox.row: Someone in my household was experiencing symptoms
I was stocking up to be prepared
I was replenishing the products we use in my household – I had run out of cold/flu OTC products
I was replenishing – I still had some at home but wanted to have more on hand
I was already at the store buying other things anyway
I saw an advertisement for the product
A coupon, promotion, or sale influenced me
Someone in my life, that is not a medical professional, recommended the product
A medical professional recommended the product

radio.label: Q_SHOP1C
radio.title: How long were you experiencing symptoms prior to shopping for cough, cold, & flu products? Please answer the question regarding you recent experienced symptoms: [pipe: S_Symptom].
radio.row: I was just starting to experience symptoms
I had been experiencing symptoms for a few days
I had been experiencing symptoms for a week or longer
I was starting to recover and feel better

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP1D
checkbox.title: Which of the following best describes the reasons why you waited to buy [pipe:Category]?
checkbox.row: The symptoms were not that serious
I was too busy and didn't have time to shop
I used natural remedies (e.g. honey, tea) instead of OTC products
I wanted to avoid taking products
I already had products on hand at home
I wanted to wait for the symptoms to go away on their own
I was using home remedies to treat my symptoms
I didn't have time to purchase sooner
I was taking care of other ill household members
I saw a doctor who recommended I purchase products to treat my symptoms

radio.label: Q_SHOP1E
radio.title: How many days did you wait before shopping for [pipe:Category]?

radio.label: Q_ProductSelection
radio.title: Did you have a specific product in mind before shopping for [pipe:Category]?
radio.row: Yes, I had a specific product in mind and I purchased that product
Yes, I had a specific product in mind but I was open to exploring other products
I had multiple products in mind and made up my mind while shopping
No, I did not have a specific product in mind and needed help to decide what was right for me

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP2
checkbox.title: Where did you conduct research, if any, before buying cough, cold, & flu products? Please answer the question regarding your recent purchase of the following products: [pipe: S_Brand_PastPurchased]?
checkbox.row: At the store by looking at available products on the shelves
At the store by asking someone who works there
On my mobile phone while at the store
At home or another place (not at a store)
I did not do any research prior to buying [pipe:Category]

checkbox.label: Q_SHOP3
checkbox.title: Which of these sources did you use to do research for your purchase of cough, cold, & flu products at [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO]? Please answer the question regarding your recent purchase of the following products:[pipe: S_Brand_PastPurchased]
checkbox.row: Recommendation from in-store professionals (i.e. pharmacist, store associate, etc.)
Recommendation from a healthcare professional (i.e. a doctor, nurse practitioner, etc.)
Recommendation from influencers, e.g. content creators on Instagram or Youtube.com
On social media (e.g, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, etc.)
Online review and information websites and articles, e.g., WebMD.com, Mayoclinic.com, etc.
Online groups and discussion boards, e.g., reddit

textarea.label: Q_SHOP3A

block.html: In this section we would like you to imagine you are about to buy over the counter [pipe: Category] at a retailer in-store. You will see a range of different offers presented - each time at a different price. Please select the offer that you would buy.

number.label: Q_DecisionFactors_Version
number.title: Q_DecisionFactors - MaxDiff Version

radio.label: Q_DecisionFactors_[loopvar: task]
radio.title:
Task [MDcount]/18
Thinking about when you were buying over the counter [pipe: Category] from a retailer, which factors were most and least important to your decision?
radio.comment: In this exercise you will see several different sets of five factors each. Some factors may get repeated over different sets. For each set, please select the factor that is most important and least important to you in that set. Please select only one factor for Most Important, and one factor for Least Important (Most Important and Least Important cannot be the same factor).

survey.html: Thank you for telling us about your experiences shopping for [pipe: Category]. For these next few questions, we’d like to understand how you felt after you finished your shopping trip.

radio.label: Q_Post1
radio.title: After taking cough, cold, & flu products, how soon did you begin to feel fully better from symptoms? Please answer the question regarding you recent experienced symptoms: [pipe: S_Symptom] and your recent purchase of the following products: [pipe: S_Brand_PastPurchased]
radio.row: I did not feel full relief after taking the cough, cold, & flu products

checkbox.label: Q_Post1B
checkbox.title: What did you do after you did not feel symptom relief after taking the medication you purchased?
checkbox.row: I bought more cough, cold, & flu products
I bought a different product from the same brand(s) to treat my symptoms
I bought a similar product from different brand(s)
I waited for symptoms to go away on their own
I went to a doctor or other medical professional
I used other medication I had in my medicine cabinet
I used non-medicated remedies such as tea or herbal supplements

radio.label: Q_Post1C
radio.title: After your symptoms went away, which of the following did you do to recover from your illness?
radio.row: I continued to take cough, cold, & flu products after I felt symptom relief
I bought a different products or supplement to recover from my illness
I didn't do anything after I felt symptom relief

text.label: Q_Post1C_OE
text.title: Please be as detailed and thorough as possible:

checkbox.label: Q_Post1D
checkbox.title: What products do you purchase to help recover from your illness post-symptom?
checkbox.row: Cleaning products, such as antibacterial/ disinfectant spray
Hydration products, such as sports drinks or powdered electrolyte supplements
Over the counter medications (tablets, syrups, etc.) found in the aisle
Behind-the-counter medications (tablets, syrups, etc.) found behind the pharmacy counter
Sleep aids and supplements (i.e. melatonin supplements, ZzzQuil, etc.)
Non-medicated homeopathic/natural remedies (i.e. zinc supplements, honey, tea, etc.)
Immune Support Supplement (i.e. Vitamin C supplements, Airborne, or Emergen-C)
Cough drops or lozenges (i.e. Halls, Ricola, Cepacol)
Lip moisturization products such as Chapstick
Cold sore treatment such as Abreva

radio.label: Q_Post2
radio.title: How satisfied were you with your experience shopping for [pipe: Category] at [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO]?

radio.label: Q_Post2B
radio.title: How likely are you to shop for [pipe: Category] at [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO] in the future?
radio.row: I would go back to [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO] for [pipe: Category]
I would shop at [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO] again, but not for [pipe: Category]
I would not go back to [pipe: S_Retailer_BUMO] to shop for anything

radio.label: Q_ReliefFinder
radio.title: When shopping for [pipe: Category], did you use a relief finder app or website online (similar to the one pictured here)?
radio.row: Yes, I used a relief finder application online/on my phone
No, I did not use a relief finder application online/on my phone

radio.label: Q_ReliefFinder_Yes
radio.title: Did you find the relief finder to be useful?

radio.label: Q_Prevention
radio.title: Throughout the year, do you shop for products to prevent illness/symptoms before important events (i.e. travel plans, wedding, birthday, etc.)?
